comment: Katherine Perrotta is an excellent professor! She's very flexible and understanding. Her classes are well organized and her teaching and tests are very straight forward. All her tests are from her lectures and PowerPoints. Yes, the textbook is required but it's not necessary to read everything. You can still get by from just skimming the chapters.

I took this as an online class and loved it. Dr. Perrotta made history enjoyable for me. Some complain about the amount of work given each week, but it's doable. All quizzes online--no lockdown browser. Critical book review at the end of the semester wasn't hard just plan accordingly and don't procrastinate. Take her!!

Professor Perotta treats this class like its a major class instead of a core class. Discussion posts due every week that are a minimum of three paragraphs and you have to use multiple citations. The textbook is a must so you have to buy that. There are quizzes every week and a paper due at the end of the semester, with a 100 question final exam.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY--Clear grading criteria

comment: Fine class. Weekly discussion boards with peer responses that count more than the weekly quizzes. The discussion boards are graded strictly. I would write between 800 and 1200 words for each post so they felt like weekly essays. The book report was a good portion of your grade and there is no midterm only a final.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She's a good professor and wants you to learn, but for being a gen ed course, she makes you do a lot of work. In depth 3 par. discussion post with citations from textbook and secondary book due every week plus a quiz but those are easy. Critical book review due at the end of semester. She does offer unlimited extra credit. Haven't taken final yet..
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: By far the BESTTT history teacher Ive ever had. She really knows her stuff, its her true passion. I took the class online which was the best decision I couldve ever made. The class consists of a discussion board required to do 5 but do all 8 easy extra credit(also 3 paragraph requirement reply to 2 classmates)14 quizzes 2/week

WATCH HER LECTURES! Not only is she a great teacher, but her quizzes pull strictly from her lectures. Weekly Discussion Boards are crucial. She makes you learn! If you watch her lectures and read the chapters, you will get a good grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This class is decently easy but should be easier. The professor treats the class too much like a literature class. Weekly argumentative research essays are required and she takes off points for all of the little things like incorrect citations or not using a proper source. She focuses too much on the little things. It's only a general ed class..
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: This class is so easy!!!! Weekly discussions but they are not hard and the same topic each week, so theoretically you could get ahead on the class if you want. I had a health issue and she was able to meet and help me work out my schedule. Easy class, unlimited extra credit!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She has weekly discussion post that requires 3 citations 2 from the book you read and 1 from a credible source (outside material). Weekly quizzes that are harder than you expect it to be. If you're looking for a easy A, don't choose this class cause you will have to put in the work. otherwise take it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I took the online class over the summer and she was great! Only had to do a discussion post and two quizzes every week. For the discussion posts she cared about what you wrote and will ask you questions to engage your mind more and form strong thoughts which I LOVED. Would take her again if I had the chance!
Very good professor, is very kind, fast response to question through email, and has a passion for what she teaches, would recommend to anyone!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: LOVED DR PERROTTA! Class consisted of 4 tests on d2l, one paper/presentation and participation on other's presentation. She got to know you by name and started lots of discussions. However, it does feel a little high school with "Brainstorm" activities and group discussions but I feel like it enhances the material and makes time go by quicker. TAKE

DON"T BE ON YOUR PHONE! She will flip out on you. she is very nice, caring and youthful though. One presentation/paper which wasn't bad. online tests on d2l. It is true that it feels like a high school class, take that as a good or bad thing. Regular class consists of copying slides from lecture. She will get to know you by name, good professor.

She takes the class very seriously and treats it more like a high school class than a college one. There are 4 test which are online but make sure you give a detailed short answer with lots of quotes. There is one presentation with a paper, which wasn't too bad. You can also earn extra credit by visiting historical sites. Overall, an A is doable.

Initially I did not like her, but as the semester went on I realized that she is very nice. 3 tests w/ short answer, easy because it's all off ppts shown in class. Go into detail in the short answers and you should be fine. 1 group project/presentation, which was easy. Highly recommend!

Very nice. Has clear and easy to follow Power Points- all on D2L. You get split into groups for a project and you'll likely be great friends with them the whole semester. They'll be helpful! Group Project is a turning point in history- consists of a paper and group presentation. Tough grader on paper. 3 Tests, 1 final (all online). Get textbook.

If your reading this you are considering, so I will say this. AVOID AT ALL COST!!! She has critique discussions every week that is graded, quizzes every week, homework every week. three papers, and three test. but if that didn't seem long enough 100 question final with 120min to complete. but if your still reading your looking for more, OK then RUN

This class was pretty easy, but there is a lot of work that goes into it being an online class. Weekly discussion posts and quizzes. They are not hard, but you definitely need to make sure you plan accordingly so the work is turned in by the deadline. Great teacher who is always available to help.

Professor Perrotta makes history interesting. The test are easy, however she grades short answers for the test somewhat difficult. One group project which is an easy grade. Very nice and helpful when needed. Go to class and you should be able to get an A.

Omg... Shes not an awful person but teacher? No. She grades you based on what she wants to know, not your research. Theres 4 test, all online. The presentation isn't hard. Her lectures are boring and shes very irritable. Lectures are online. If you visit a historical site you can get extra credit.

the thing about perotta is that she wants to make the class interesting but not many people find it that way. 4 tests that are online and pretty easy multiple choice 1 short answer. you get a feel for what she looks forward on the short answer part. got all As on them. 1 group project and it wasn't really a challenge. 1 3-4 page paper slightly hard
She grades very harshly on the papers you have to write, and even after revisions and all the time you put in she still is not lenient at all

I thoroughly enjoyed Prof. Perrotta's class, but the reason this class is hard is her confusing grading scheme. She gives clear requirements for the short answer portion of tests, but if you simply meet the requirements it's a failing grade. I think her grading process is misleading and sometimes confusing so watch out if you plan to have her.

Lectures are long, but she is an amazing teacher. She actually really cares about her students and memorized everyones name.. what professor in college cares enough to do that?? She is very personable and helpful and emails you frequently to remind you of assignments which are very easy. Tests are online. Can easily google. Im not good at history.
